common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users across macOS and Windows are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  The error is a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code, indicating the service isn't running or accessible at the expected endpoint (http://127.0.0.1:39300). Check if Pieces Core Services is running, verify network connectivity, and ensure the correct port is configured. Reinstallation may be necessary.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Core Services
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Core Services
Error: WebSocketException: Connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' was not upgraded to websocket, HTTP status code: 404

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: /Applications/Pieces OS.app

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: FB0FAE84-6BAC-4EC2-BBC8-8A15651E0677
User: 01ce0083-f75f-41c5-a161-943ada0edc94
Current Version: Unknown
Min Version Supported: 12.1.0
Max Version Supported: 13.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: MacOS
Current Version: Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)
Min Version Supported: 12.0.0 Monterey

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users across macOS and Windows are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  A WebSocketException with a 404 error indicates a connection failure to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#'.  This suggests an issue with the local Pieces Core Services server. Check if the service is running, restart the application, and ensure firewall isn't blocking the connection.

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users across macOS and Windows are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  The error message indicates a WebSocket connection failure with a 404 HTTP status code. This suggests an issue with the Pieces Core Services server not being accessible or responding correctly.  Check if the service is running, firewall settings, and network connectivity.

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users across macOS and Windows are unable to open Pieces Core Services.  The error is a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code, indicating the service is not running or accessible at the expected endpoint (http://127.0.0.1:39300). Check if Pieces Core Services is running, verify firewall settings, and ensure the correct port is being used. Reinstallation may be necessary.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Unable to open Pieces Core Services" issue, focusing on the WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code. Investigate the root cause across macOS and Windows, considering firewall settings, network connectivity, and service status.
Provide troubleshooting steps or a workaround for users experiencing the "Unable to open Pieces Core Services" issue while a permanent fix is being developed.
Investigate reported slow/laggy performance of the Pieces desktop application and the lack of response in Copilot chat (Ticket #315).
Address the Ollama installation failure on Linux (Ticket #537) and the Long-Term Memory feature not working on Linux (Ticket #568).
Investigate Raycast Extension incompatibility (Ticket #781) and the crash when scrolling or moving a window to another screen (Ticket #771).
